critique: This document establishes a board to examine and report on the most urgently required ports for fortifications and other defenses. It also discusses the character and kind of defenses best adapted for each, with reference to armament, and the utilization of torpedoes, mines, or other defensive appliances. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion based on this document. The document seems neutral.
